009package Tools_;
010
011import ij.IJ;
012import ij.ImagePlus;
013import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
014import ij.plugin.PlugIn;
015import imagingbook.common.util.DirectoryWalker;
016
017import java.io.File;
018import java.util.Collection;
019
020/**
021 * This is a simple tool for converting images of a specific type in a given directory to a new type using ImageJ. There
022 * is no safety net except the option for performing a dry run. Converted files are placed in the same directory as the
023 * original files. Note that nothing is polished, this is intended for quick use only.
024 *
025 * @author WB
026 * @version 2022/12/27
027 */
028public class Convert_Images_To_PNG implements PlugIn {
029        private static String SourceExtension = ".pgm";
030        private static String TargetExtension = ".png";
031        private static String CurrentDirectory =  IJ.getDirectory("current");
032        private static boolean DoDryRun = true;
033        private static boolean InvertImages = false;
034        private static boolean InvertLookupTables = false;
035        
036        public void run(String arg0) {
037                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(this.getClass().getSimpleName());
038                gd.addStringField("Source file extension", SourceExtension);
039                gd.addStringField("Target file extension", TargetExtension);
040                gd.addDirectoryField("Select directory", CurrentDirectory);
041                gd.addCheckbox("Invert images", InvertImages);
042                gd.addCheckbox("Invert lookup tables", InvertLookupTables);
043                gd.addCheckbox("Dry run", DoDryRun);
044
045                gd.showDialog();
046                if (gd.wasCanceled()) {
047                        return;
048                }
049
050                SourceExtension = gd.getNextString();
051                TargetExtension = gd.getNextString();
052                CurrentDirectory = gd.getNextString();
053                InvertImages = gd.getNextBoolean();
054                InvertLookupTables = gd.getNextBoolean();
055                DoDryRun = gd.getNextBoolean();
056
057                // -------------------
058
059                String dir = CurrentDirectory;
060                if (dir == null)
061                        return;
062
063                if (DoDryRun) {
064                        IJ.log("Doing a dry run only, nothing will be changed!");
065                }
066                IJ.log("Scanning directory " + dir + " ...");
067                Collection<String> paths =  new DirectoryWalker(SourceExtension).collectFiles(dir);
068
069                int cnt = 0;
070                for (String p : paths) {
071                        ImagePlus im = IJ.openImage(p);
072                        if (im == null) {
073                                IJ.log("WARNING: could not read/open image" + p);
074                                continue;
075                        }
076                        File f = new File(dir + im.getShortTitle() + TargetExtension);
077                        String savepath = f.getAbsolutePath();
078                        IJ.log("Converting " + p + " --> " + savepath);
079
080                        if (!DoDryRun) {
081                                if (InvertImages)
082                                        IJ.run(im, "Invert", "");       // im.getProcessor().invert();
083                                if (InvertLookupTables)
084                                        IJ.run(im, "Invert LUT", "");
085
086                                IJ.save(im, savepath);
087                        }
088                        im.close();
089                        cnt++;
090                }
091
092                IJ.log("Processed " + cnt + " files.");
093        }
094}
095
